skill.description: Agile ceremonies and sprint management specialist. Use when running standups, retrospectives, sprint planning, or tracking sprint progress.
skill.summary: Agile ceremonies and sprint management specialist. Use when running standups, retrospectives, sprint...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only markdown templates for agile ceremonies. All 30 static findings are false positives caused by markdown code fences being misidentified as shell backticks, agile terminology like 'In Progress' being flagged as network reconnaissance, and file hashes in the report JSON being flagged as weak cryptography. No executable code exists.

content.user_title: Run Agile Ceremonies with Structured Templates
content.value_statement: Teams struggle to run consistent and productive agile ceremonies. This skill provides ready-to-use templates for standups, retrospectives, and sprint tracking.
actual_capabilities: Generate structured daily standup reports for individuals or teams
Create sprint retrospective documents with action item tracking
Track sprint progress with burndown metrics and story status
Produce weekly summary reports with velocity trends
Support async standup formats for distributed teams
Document team health metrics and mood checks
limitations: Does not integrate with project management tools like Jira or Asana
Templates require manual data entry for metrics and status
No automatic velocity calculation or chart generation
Cannot track historical sprint data across sessions

use_cases.title: Facilitate Daily Standups
use_cases.description: Generate consistent standup formats for team meetings. Track blockers and action items across team members in one document.

use_cases.title: Run Sprint Retrospectives
use_cases.description: Create comprehensive retro documents capturing what went well, issues, learnings, and action items with owner assignments.

use_cases.title: Coordinate Async Standups
use_cases.description: Use async standup templates for Slack or Discord. Keep distributed teams aligned without scheduling conflicts.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Standup
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a standup update. Yesterday I completed the login feature. Today I will work on user profile. I am blocked on database access permissions.

prompt_templates.title: Team Standup Summary
prompt_templates.scenario: Compile updates from multiple team members
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a team standup summary table for today. Include Alice (finished API, starting tests), Bob (code review, blocked on staging), and Carol (documentation, no blockers).

prompt_templates.title: Sprint Retrospective
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a retrospective for Sprint 12. Went well: shipped payment feature, good code reviews. Issues: deployment delays, unclear requirements. Actions needed: improve CI pipeline, earlier stakeholder reviews.

prompt_templates.title: Weekly Progress Report
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a weekly summary. Shipped: user authentication, profile page. In progress: dashboard at 60 percent. Velocity this week: 21 points vs 18 last week. Key learning: pair programming reduced bugs.

output_examples.input: Generate a standup for today. I finished the API endpoints yesterday. Today I will write unit tests. Blocked waiting for design mockups.
output: Today: Writing unit tests for API layer
Blockers: Waiting on design mockups (need from Design team)

output_examples.input: Create a retro summary. Good: fast releases, team collaboration. Bad: too many meetings, scope creep. Actions: limit meetings to 30 min, require written specs.
output: What Went Well: Fast release cycles, strong team collaboration
What Needs Improvement: Excessive meeting time, scope creep in stories
Action Items: Cap meetings at 30 minutes (Owner: Scrum Master), Require written specifications before sprint (Owner: Product Owner)

output_examples.input: Track sprint progress. Sprint 5, day 7 of 10. Planned 30 points, completed 22. Stories: AUTH-101 done, AUTH-102 in review, AUTH-103 blocked.
output: AUTH-101: Complete, AUTH-102: In Review, AUTH-103: Blocked

best_practices: Keep standup updates focused on work relevant to current sprint goals
Always assign owners and due dates to retrospective action items
Review previous retrospective actions at the start of each new retro
anti_patterns: Avoid turning standups into problem-solving sessions or lengthy discussions
Do not skip documenting blockers even when they seem minor
Never end a retrospective without specific actionable improvements

faq.question: What agile ceremonies does this skill support?
faq.answer: Daily standups, sprint retrospectives, sprint planning, progress tracking, and weekly summaries. Templates work for in-person and async formats.

faq.question: Can I use this for async or remote standups?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill includes async standup templates designed for Slack, Discord, or other messaging platforms.

faq.question: Does it integrate with Jira or other tools?
faq.answer: No direct integration. The skill generates formatted text you can copy into any tool or document.

faq.question: How do I track action items from retrospectives?
faq.answer: The retrospective template includes action item tables with owner, due date, and status columns for tracking.

faq.question: Can this calculate sprint velocity automatically?
faq.answer: No. You provide the metrics and the skill formats them into readable reports and tables.

faq.question: What information should I include in a standup?
faq.answer: Include what you completed, what you plan to work on, and any blockers. Be specific about what help you need.
